page.title: 10WORMBRIDGE COURT
page.content: The farmhouse now known as{Wormbridge {Court}was once the stables of {Wormbridge House,}the manor house which stood where our school playground is now. The house is built of red brick and there is a yard with farm buildings and a pond at the back. Horses for riding and hunting are still kept on the farm. The house stands on the A465 road and the farm is the biggest in Wormbridge. There is a{farm shop}next to the house where vegetables are sold. Most of these are grown on the farm land or in the{greenhouses}across the road, next to the school. Some of the vegetables grown in the field are cabbages, cauliflowers, brussel sprouts and lettuce. Last year the big pond next to the school pitch was deepened and extended so that these vegetables can be{irrigated}in dry weather.
